bio.intro: I am a political economist studying how democracies can govern artificial intelligence. My research combines experimental methods with computational modeling to understand how citizens form preferences about emerging technologies and what this means for democratic governance.

items.title: AI and democratic governance
items.description: How citizens form attitudes toward AI and how democracies can govern emerging technologies

items.title: Political behavior
items.description: Automation risk, policy preferences, and public opinion

items.title: Computational social science
items.description: Agent-based modeling, behavioral experiments, and causal inference

items.title: Latin American politics
items.description: State violence, political trust, and democratic attitudes

whatIBuild.title: What I Build
whatIBuild.intro: I create interactive tools that help researchers and students build intuition for quantitative methods. My teaching philosophy centers on helping students who did not expect to succeed at quantitative methods discover that they can.
items: **20+ interactive learning tools** built with JavaScript to help students visualize statistical concepts
**Behavioral experiment platforms** using oTree for research
**Causal modeling tools** for specifying and exporting SEM models
whatIBuild.note: All my tools are open-source and freely available.
